values: Up untill 30 sec. ago, I was really feeling, well...blah, depressed, sad, frustrated, you know. And I was planing on placeing an entry telling the world that I am a human being and not to judged me for feeling such emotions, but now I find my-self so shocked that I could laugh so hard that I might throw up. I think I'll just shut the labtop and acctually go to sleep with a smile on my face.

Did you ever have friend that walked right out in front of a moving vehicale and get seriously hurt, and you saw it all happen but didn't have the nerve to say that they were about to get hit?
Answer back please.

I have a very hard time saying good-bye, and every time I do, not knowing if and when I will see that person again, it's like a knife that stabs my heart. I hold on to the good memories to help ease the pain, and yet at the same time it's the holding on that makes the pain so much worse. The fact that I hold on to everything and never let anything go...is that bad? Do you think it does more harm than good? I save every thing. Random things that to a normal person my seem like trash like, all my concert programs and stuff animals and other toys from my childhood; random worksheets from my biology class sophmore year, and of course the endlees mound of cards from birthdays, when I was in the hospital, Christmas, thank yous from different people, and invitations. I can't even begin to explain all thats in my keepsake boxes. But I can never throw any of it away, because the moment I do I'll had wished that I didn't.

 

that reminds me, what do you guy think about the Michel Jackson vertict.

I was soposed to bring my marching band uniform and the sax I barrowed, today. and I totally forgot and if I can't get home and back to the school by 3:30 I'm going to have a $500 accountability. the sax isn't so bad cuz I can just bring it in tomarrow, but the uniform, if I don't get it in to day that means I have to take it to the dry cleaners and then bring it in before the accountability in null and void. whatever. If my mother would just text me back then I could figure out how I'm going to get home.

I feel kinda better about the whole my brag sheet not getting into the yearbook thing. After my AP English class I went to go see one of my old teachers and there I had a good cry about it. She just kind of looked at me and was like-is it that time of the month, and I was like yah!!!!! Then she gave me some chocolate and a pass to class, and I felt better about it. Like it still sucks but there's more inmortant things to worry about, like graduation and my party and going shopping for Nikki's party, which is tomarrow.

Here's a shout out: The car wash is tomarrow-so all of you in the Manchester area who have a durty car stop by, just drive down main st. it's impossible to miss us.

Last night I went to my class diner at marco polo, it was a casual thing. We had pizza and signed each other's yearbooks and saw a slide show that had some freakish looking pics in it, but it was fun. I'm going to the taste of Hartford today, which is accually in East Hartford but whatever, the band is playing, but we're not wearing our uniforms -thank God- it's sooooo stink'en hot. well I guess that's it for now.

I'm soooooo mad! I got my yearbook today and for some reason my senoir brag sheet didn't get in. The brag sheet is where you put in all the activitys you did, who you hung out w/, your goals, your quote. you get the idea, well for what ever reason mine didn't get in and I'm really mad. I'm about to cry, I know this time next year it's not going to matter, but now it does, and the thing is, is that I can't get this back.

I came to the conclusion last night that there is no such thing as procrastinating once you hit high school, because in reality a person is too busy to procrastinate, but that's what we call cuz we find our selves doing assignment and what have you, the night before they are due. So what?! Who cares?! you go it done didn't you? well if you really think about it, it's not procrastination at all, because you were wasting time. We get things done according to what needs to be done first or according to what takes priority. See it's not procrastinating, it's prioritizing. Have a Nice Day!

So saturday was a very busy day. We had this fundrasing tag sale at my aunt's, it was for our chior trip this summer. Than I had Ashleys grad. party, then I had Elise's surprise b-day party...I think I said all this already but whatever. I soooo much to do before my party, I have to finish my room and put all my stuff away (finally) and the dining room needs to be painted. Away at Ashley's I met on of her friends from school who is a Phantom fan and a Jane Austin junkie like me. Jane Austin is the author of my favorate book; Pride and Prejudice. This started out as my favorate because it's kind of chick flick-ish but really it's because I can relate to the characters so much. Mr. Darcy's a jurk but being mean is kind of his defense mechanism and his way of hinding how uncomfortable he is when he's around strangers. This, for those of you who don't know me, is very much like me. When I get around people I don't know it's like I freeze up or something. I'll just stand there like a stick and not say anything, unless someone comes and talks to me. Then there is Elizabeth, who waltzes to her own tune and does whatever the heck she feels like and deffise all social rules. Then I was singing "I remember there was mist..." from the Phantom and we got talking about the musical and the movie and how there's a lot of people who don't like the guy who plays the Phantom and how the were very mild about his messed up face...ect. well I guess that's it. I'm tired, I need to go to sleep.

it's soo awesome being a senoir!!!!!!!! accutally it's just nice to nolonger be a junior! Junior was aweful!!! but this year, this year is great! however I'm really disapionted that I have to read "Wethering Hights" in A.P. English (I hate wethering Hights, it's soooo stupid the guy and the girl that are soposed to get together don't and then the marry their cousons then they all die) and the other A.P. English class is reading "Pride and Prejustice" and as you all know Pride and Prejustice is like my all time favorate book in the world!!!!! well any ways this is how my schedule goes...

Per.          Class            Days          Mark.Per.

A             Chem.          12345        1234

B             Chem. Lab   1                1234

B             P.E. Phycl.    24             12

B             P.E. Health   35              12

B            Study Hall      2345          34

C            A.P. English   12345        1234

D            Trig.               12345       12

D            Calc.              12345       34

E            Treble Chior    12345      1234

F            Photography 1 12345      12

F            Child Develop. 12345      34

G           Band!!!!!           12345     1234

 

so that's my schedule for this year, I'm kind of busy but it's mostly electives. I only have three accademics and their easy I'm good at English and Math and b/c Chem. uses alot of Math, I think I'll be good at that too. 

well there's no point in keeping it a secret any more. my new destination is 200 Spring st !!!!

<FONT color=#ff6600 size=5>well not a whole lot has happened sense sunday. yesterday Elise came over at 10:00 and woke me up and I was all confused cuz on sunday night she droped me off after singing to Pastor Libbe and she came inside and we had ice cream, so, when she woke me up I was like did Elise sleep over? she didn't. anyways we went to go look at the house on spring st. and then we went back to my uncle's house and we went swimming. Stephen and Josh were there. well I guess that's it.</FONT>

so I haven't updated in over a week b/c of moving, preseason and the specail mtgs at church.

yah moving wasn't fun. people came over on sat. and moved some stuff into the pod. Elise slept over my house and we watched 13 going on 30 and the prince and me. that was nice cuz I haven't been able to hang w/ Elise sense last summer cuz were both soooo busy. we talked till 2 in the morning. Then sunday night was the last night I slept in my house. I slept on the floor of my room b/c my beds were already taken apart and put on the pod. I've never cried and felt sooo missurable in my life I thought I'd die, I felt so awfull.

then the next day I had preseason and we marched around inside b/c of the rain. then when I got home I just laid on my bedroom floor and cried some more. then later people came over to help finish moving. I docutmented the whole thing in my hand writen journal and this is how it went.

 

Monday August 16, 2004     7:02 P.M.

well's there people her now. I don't know exactly who but Mydrieanne (Adrieanne) is down there. I could go get a hug but I rather be missurable. I ca't believe that in just a matter of hours I will say good-bye to the only home I ever known--well that's not entirely true b/c the Labbes were like a second family and a second home, speaking of which I saw Heather last night and she's pregnant, #4 and I almost cried. she was there to see her Mom come home from alabama. I think I'll go down stairs just to see who's down there.

7:23 P.M.

well so far here are the people helping w/ the move, Inez, Aurora, Mikey, John, Addie, Dave Owens, Leo Christiana, Mark Barrieu, Matt and Pete Penecki.

7:26 P.M.

As I look at all the furineture that guys are moving out I wonder- how the heck did we get in there in the 1st place?

7:40 P.M.

Joey S. in here now and that wierd tall guy who play the gutair in band. What's his name? Bill?

11:35 P.M.

well now I'm at Uncle Kenny's so far I'm ok but I do miss my room already.

and that's all of the documentry and I did really good I didn't cry all week over the house. I think It was b/c I was so busy w/ preseason and which on tues I got burt really really bad. but I didn't do it on pupose. I have been know not to put sunscreen on b/c I want to get a tan, but this time I really just forgot. but the rest of the week I put stuff on so I wouldn't get burt any more. so anyways I was doing good cring wise over the house, untill friday, the closing day. I went to preseason and got there at 7:30 like I always do b/c my mom needs to get to work on time so I was there doing set up stuff and I had to leave and go get my yearbook pics. done at 9:00 inside the school and I saw my friends Erica and Tom. do you guys remember them. well any ways I got my pics done and so did they and then we talked and chilled in the hallway and then I remembered that my dad was sopossed to pick me up early around 2:00 but I wasn't sure so I called him to just check and he was like I didn't know i was sopposed to pick you up and them he started freaking out and then I started freaking out and then I just kind of snapped and I started breatheing heavy and I was like I gotta go home. so I called my mom and told her that dad din't know he was sopposed to pick my up and she was like I know he just called me and then I was like mom I gotta go home I gotta go home and she was like ok Camille calm down and then I walked to the football feild where my new band derecter was w/ the band and I was like Miss. White I gotta go home and I started cring and of course she was like ah...are you ok. and I'm like NO!! I gotta go home and I told I was just upset cuz it was the day of the closing of the house that I've lived in all my life. she under stood and I went home. I worked out good b/c there was still alot of packing and cleaning to do. and I got to say good-bye to my house. and I got to keep the keys to my house. 

so, can I just say that the specail mtgs. have been awesome!!! Pastor Downs is an awesome precher. shoot!! and then this morning w/ Pastor and "it's not by might, it's not by power, but it's by the spirit of God" it's so easy to grow in God and start to grow in your ministrys and you start to think that your so great and that you don't need to pray and that you don't need to read your bible but it's in those times that you need to read it more and pray more. well I guess that's it for now. I can't wait till wed. I'm sleeping over Nikki's house. it's gonna be so much fun. HEY, HOW COME NO ONE COMMENTS ANY MORE? IS LJ NO LONGER A FORM OF COMUNICATION?

wow...ok...I happend to be looking through some of my old entrys and I found this one w/ a comment that I had never read before and it was soooo awesome that I just had to share it w/ you all!!!!!!

a hazzy, rubbery feeling

 Last night was...well you guys know. all I have to say is I haven't cried like in soooo long, it was like I was just letting everything out, like I was just taking off all the heavy burdens and leaving them at the alter. Funny part: my nose got all runny and a cuple times snot fell on the floor.(Lauren wasn't there to cetch it--LOL) but yah, anyways I went home so dazzed, and my arms and legs felt all rubbery and I could hardly move. I woke up this morning and my I lids were all swollen from cring last night, but I don't care, I'm just so thankful for God's freeing power, and for giving us a Pastor who watches out for our souls!

umm. . .hey!

2004-04-09 13:21 (link)

i know you dont know me and i dont know you either but i've gotten into a habit of doing random lj searches. . .and this time your journal came up =) i just want to say that i know that feeling. . .when God comes and touches you like that. . .and i want you to know that i was so encouraged just reading that. keep at it. GOD IS SO GOOD!!

 

 

 ISN'T THAT AWESOME!!!! That totally made my day 'er night...whatever! wow!!!!! hey maybe this person will see the last entry I posted and be encoureged again!!!!

I hate to be the bearer of bad news but, THE SUMMER IS ALMOST OVER!!!!! well we, H.A.'F.Y.C., leave tomarrow night for N. Carolina. I'm a little scared and a little excited. what's really awesome, (for all of you who don't know) is that were running all 5 mtgs. there. It'll be like 5 youth nights in a row! it's awesome.

well I'm gonna say it everyday untill they come to visit, I MISS TROY AND STACY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! However, I think ALL the Fraziers should come to visit, b/c I miss Rachel, Sarah and Joanna too.

ok can I just say, that I am sooo grateful to know the Lord. Seriously, I don't know how people live their lives...b/c...ok...1st of all, to be unsure of what the future holds and to not know where you're going when you die, totally freaks me out! 2nd of all, I know that I'm never alone b/c God is always w/ me in what ever situation I face in life. 3rd, I know that my life has meaning, I know my life has purpise. If you can't live for God than what are you living for...just to breathe in and out every day and than die. It's no wonder the suicide rates go up day by day, b/c people don't know that their life can make a difference in others lives, even through their mistakes. And while I'm on this subject, don't ever use the stupid excuss that "oh I'm only hurting myself, I'm not hurting anyone else" b/c that is such a load of crap!!!! every thing you do in your life in going to effect and possably hurt at least one other person's life. and I'm not saying that you should be constently living your life for other people, I'm saying, don't take the impalse to do something stupid just b/c you think it's not hurting anyone else, b/c it will effect and hurt someone else. ok back to what I was talking about before. 4th, it's wonderful to know that when you're going though something, there is someone you can rely on through what ever it is and that just when you're just about to give up that's when the victory becomes in site, and if you can hold on for just a little longer, the victory is yours. People in the world don't have that. Yah I'm really thankful to know who God is. you know I was thinking about this the other day. sometimes it's hard for us kids who've grown up in church to really appreciate salvation b/c to us it comes so easilly, and sometimes it's just something we do, b/c we're tought that, that's how we make our way to heaven and it's just something that we're surrounded by. well I was thinking how when you grow up in the world and you're not saved and you get saved later on, your salvation means ever thing to you and if walking on your hands for the rest of your life was how you stayed saved, you'd do it, b/c your life has been changed. Not that for those of us who've grown up in church don't have a life changing experience, but most of us have good parents who are saved and we have peace in our homes and when we're sick or have a need they pray w/ us. And we know (b/c we're thought) that God will forgive us no matter what. Alot of people out in the world, who come to Christ don't have that, and when they find salvation it means soooo much to them. I've also come to be really thankful that I know the truth, and that I'm not living a lie. I really feel bad for people who do, and what's really upsetting, is that when you go to tell them the truth they don't what to hear it, but I least you've done your part in trying to bring truth to them.

Well I hope I wasn't just ramballing on forever and that somehow this has encoureged you in some way.

You are 'Hark! The Herald Angels Sing'. You take
Christmas very seriously. For you, it is a
religious festival, celebrating the birth of
the Saviour, and its current secularisation
really irritates you. You enjoy the period of
Advent leading up to Christmas, and attend any
local carol services you can find, as well as
the more contemplative Advent church services
each Sunday. You may be involved in Christmas
food collections or similar charity work. The
midnight service at your church, with candles
and carols, is one you look forward to all
year, and you also look forward to the family
get together on Christmas Day.
